text:
Taking note of the gravity of the offence where a 15-year-old girl was kidnapped from a city-based shelter and allegedly forced into prostitution by several persons, the Madras High Court on Tuesday transferred the investigation to CB-CID, anti-trafficking cell, Chennai.

Noting that it is high time the working of the Child Welfare Committee in district and State levels was reinforced, the Division Bench comprising Justices R. Sudhakar and P.N. Prakash said, “Taking into account the plight of the deprived children abandoned by society and the need to safeguard their rights, we are inclined to call upon Mr. Lalvena, IAS, Director, Department of Social Defence, to appear before the court on January 19 to apprise the steps taken to fill the vacancies and provide infrastructure that is required in all these homes.”

The minor girl who was rescued from a child trafficking gang a year ago and placed in Madras Christian Council of Social Service , Jawahar Nagar, Chennai, went missing five months ago.

Based on a complaint lodged on July 22 by the home and a Habeas Corpus petition moved before the High Court, the girl was rescued by police and found to be pregnant.

On Tuesday, when the petition came up for hearing, considering the age of the victim and her present condition, the proceeding was held in-camera in the chamber of Justice R. Sudhakar.

Concurring with the contention of activist A. Narayanan, who impleaded himself in the petition , the judges also directed the Child Welfare Committee to determine the possibility of termination of pregnancy and proceed as per the law.
title: Court transfers minor rape case to CB-CID
